content.description: Start a little to the left of Rain on my Fire Escape then traverse right.  Using the top is off.  Not extremely hard but pumpy.  Finish out to the right of the finish for The Curse.
This route follows a crack on the left side of the boulder. You sit start on the face just before it starts jetting back into the cave. Go straight up the crack and top it out. Not too much to it.

Sit start on the white block to the left of the cave. Move up to the right of the crack, but then make a dyno up and to the right and hold on. Weird pocketed crimps run straight up from the "big throw" to a mantle top out.
content.protection: A pad and 2 spotters less you want to fall down a hill to your back or a descending trail to your left(hence the routes name).

content.description: Sit start with right hand in a slot on the arete and left hand in a small crimp in the seam under the roof make tenuous moves out the roof. Detached feet to the right are not on.
content.location: To the right of The Curse.

content.description:
This route starts in the cave on the left face. It starts with the two pinches on this small face. Go straight out to the arete, follow the arete to the top-out. Don't use wall behind the route which will make it much easier.  

  This is a very cool climb and you'll get a lot of attention from all the hikers on the trail because they can't miss you.  

  When I climb this route it somewhat reminds me of the very popular route, "The Overhang" by the Pavilion.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter so you don't fall down the cliff.

content.description: This little rock houses some short but sweet routes. The block is maybe 8 feet tall, but it will keep you occupied for awhile. It is very pocketed limestone which will make some of the routes interesting if you are selective of the holds.
